turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Badblocks.
turn.2: Badblocks  badblocks is a Linux utility to check for bad sectors on a disk drive.
turn.4: It creates a list of these sectors that can be used with other programs, like mkfs, so that they are not used in the future and thus do not cause corruption of data.
turn.6: It is part of the e2fsprogs project, and a port is available for BSD operating systems.
turn.8: When run as a standalone program, badblocks gives a list of blocks with problems, if any.
turn.9: Is it used to find bad blocks?
turn.10: This makes it a good option for checking whether the disk drive is healthy, independent of SMART data and file system checks.
turn.11: Is it used to repair the drive?
turn.12: A more common use case is the invocation of badblocks as part of e2fsck when passing the option codice_1 to scan for bad blocks and prevent data from being stored on these blocks.
